Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, krater, dinos, or bowl; interior glazed black; exterior: black band at top, animal frieze below, consisting of confronting animals (at right, ram's head with added red on neck, horns, and face; at left, snout with red of unidentified animal, possibly a bull).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 472, no. B813)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 40, pl. XX, no. 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1189)
